p.k: Canada's Timber Timbre is composed of musicians Taylor Kirk, Simon Trottier, Mathieu Charbonneau, and Mark Wheaton. With its timeless sound, the group offers a completely new interpretation of folk and blues.
p.d: Canada's Timber Timbre is composed of musicians Taylor Kirk, Simon Trottier, Mathieu Charbonneau, and Mark Wheaton. With its timeless sound, the group offers a completely new interpretation of folk and blues. The band's name refers to an early series of recordings set in a timber-framed cabin in the wooded outskirts of Ontario. The cinematic and agonizing sound of the band has been described as "an aesthetic rooted in swampy, ragged blues" and "beautifully restrained blues from an alternate universe".
